FieldArn.description: The Amazon Resource Name (ARN) of the field.

FieldId.description: The unique identifier of a field.

Namespace.description: Indicates whether this is a System field (predefined by AWS) or a Custom field (created by your organization). System fields cannot be modified or deleted.

CreatedTime.description: The time at which the field was created.

LastModifiedTime.description: The time at which the field was created or last modified.

description: A field in the Cases domain. This field is used to define the case object model (that is, defines what data can be captured on cases) in a Cases domain.

Description.description: A description explaining the purpose and usage of this field in cases. Helps agents and administrators understand what information should be captured in this field.

DomainId.description: The unique identifier of the Cases domain.

Name.description: The display name of the field as it appears to agents in the case interface. Should be descriptive and user-friendly (e.g., 'Customer Priority Level', 'Issue Category').

Tags.description: The tags that you attach to this field.

Type.description: The data type of the field, which determines validation rules, input constraints, and display format. Each type has specific constraints: Text (string input), Number (numeric values), Boolean (true/false), DateTime (date/time picker), SingleSelect (dropdown options), Url (URL validation), User (Amazon Connect user selection).
